system.description:
You have become a truly inspiring leader, resilient, inspirational, and deadly to your foes. You are almost certainly loved by your allies and a force of terror to your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

  • You become proficient with either Wisdom or Dexterity saving throws.

  • When you use Mark Foe, you can spend a use of Bardic Inspiration to enhance it in one of the following ways:

    • Its range increases to 120 feet for this use.

    • The target is outlined in a faerie fire effect until the start of your next turn.

    • The target takes an additional 1d4 psychic damage from weapon attacks or spells from you or your allies.
  • Your Battle Hymn feature’s range increases to the range of your Commanding Presence.

  • When you choose the targets for a Battle Hymn, you can cause all creatures affected by it to either heal a number of hit points equal to your bardic inspiration die or take an equal amount of psychic damage. Once you have used this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
